page.title: 14HOUSING IN BAYSTON HILL
page.content: Most of the houses in Bayston Hill are semi-detached.There are semi-detached council houses, many of which have been purchased by the tenants, all round the junior school campus.Elsewhere there are private semi-detached houses, bungalows,domerbungalows.Amongst these are some detached houses.The more recently built tend to be open plan while the rest have enclosed gardens. There are some old peoples bungalows next to the school.Several cottages built in the late 1800s still remain.Above the shops there are flats.Lythwood Hall has been divided up into separate units.One of its two gate houses remains as Lythwood Lodge.The further up Lyth Hill Road you go the houses become grander.The very rich people live on the top of Lyth Hill.
